text:
hudson woods by lang architecture is a residential retreat in upstate new york feb 05, 2017 hudson woods by lang architecture is a residential retreat in upstate new york 

in the catskills, 100 miles north of new york city , architect drew lang has designed an upscale enclave of cabins comprised of 26 individual properties. integrated within the natural landscape, dwellings come in two basic layout options that can be fully customized with pre-selected materials and upgrades — ranging from architectural additions to locally-designed furniture pieces. 
the development is in the catskills, 100 miles north of new york cityimage by deborah d 


developed by new york-based lang architecture , the ‘hudson woods’ project reinterprets the modern cabin vernacular with a design that incorporates the latest in domestic technologies. the scheme places an emphasis on sustainability with locally sourced materials, passive solar design, and a high‐efficiency hydronic heating system. through strategic site planning, there are fewer homes on ample land, leaving a smaller overall footprint. 
the upscale enclave of cabins comprises 26 individual propertiesimage by deborah d 


referencing scandinavian and mid-century design aesthetics, the properties feature white oak for interior walls and bluestone sourced on site. the nature of the scheme means that buyers receive a turn-key home, without the lengthy process of designing and building a custom dwelling from the ground-up. residences at ‘hudson woods’ start at €765,000 USD, with each lot ranging from 2.7 to over 10 acres.
